summary: In this context, hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) is identified as a toxic oxygen metabolite implicated in the pathogenesis of oxygen toxicity and lung injury. It is produced by activated neutrophils and other phagocytic cells during inflammatory responses. The discussion highlights H2O2's role as a molecular mediator of tissue damage in conditions like acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and oxygen toxicity, suggesting a direct relationship between the two.
